expectation: Arrive at the polling station during designated voting hours
situation: Polls stay open all day and the voter has a light schedule.

expectation: Arrive at the polling station during designated voting hours
situation: Late-afternoon errands leave just a couple of hours before the polls close.

expectation: Arrive at the polling station during designated voting hours
situation: The station is set to lock its doors in ten minutes.
Multiple ID types are acceptable, and spare cards can still be fetched later in the day.
This morning is the voter’s only chance to grab a valid ID from home, though the polls remain open tomorrow.
The polls close for good tonight, and this moment is the voter’s sole opportunity to present the mandated ID.

expectation: Follow all instructions provided by election officials
situation: Officials ask voters with last names A–M to move to a newly opened line, even though the original line is moving faster.

expectation: Follow all instructions provided by election officials
situation: A poll worker requests that the voter re-sign a smudged envelope so the ballot will not risk rejection later.

expectation: Follow all instructions provided by election officials
situation: An official explains that, because of a registration mismatch, the voter must complete a provisional ballot form before the station closes in ten minutes.
